title: Design & Construction Manager
description:
***Great company. Great people. Great opportunities.***


If you’d like the chance to make your mark with the world’s largest equipment rental provider, **come build your future with United Rentals!**

As a Design & Construction Manager at United Rentals, you will manage the design, planning, construction, maintenance, alteration and repair of the company’s buildings and facilities as assigned in accordance with corporate real estate strategy. You will also be responsible for managing regional construction projects within budget guidelines and established timeframes, seeking opportunities for cost reductions and efficiencies.

**What you’ll do:**

* Develop project scope and for all construction projects in conjunction with field operations, and Regional Real Estate Managers
* Manage turnkey delivery of new locations from site selection and negotiation through project management and close out
* Develop timeline to meet occupancy requirements
* Coordinate, supervise and monitor entitlement and permitting processes to coincide with project scope and management
* Ensure all construction projects meet URI facility specifications and branding requirements (new construction and remodels)
* Coordinate all ancillary requirements
* Ensure appropriate safety equipment and security measures are in place
* Coordinate, supervise and monitor construction resources and compliance with established timelines, budget, and standard specifications
* Manage project cost, negotiate vendor bids and review vendor invoices for accuracy and compliance with budget and payment approval process
* Ensure compliance with agreed upon building and development specifications

**Requirements:**

* B.S. in Civil Engineering, Construction Management, Architecture or related field (or equivalent combination of education and experience)
* 5-7 years related experience in commercial construction, managing projects
* Experience working on construction in an industrial/commercial environment for a company with an aggressive growth strategy
* Excellent communication, analytical and organizational skills.
* Microsoft Office (Project, Word, Excel); AutoCAD
* Timberline, Marathon or related software preferred
* Comprehensive knowledge of design and construction techniques, and the ability to analyze and evaluate construction bids
* **60-70% travel**


This position is deemed Safety Sensitive for purposes of United Rentals’ policies and procedures.

***Why join us?***
==================


We don’t just “talk the talk!” We’re an award-winning company (recently named a Glassdoor Best Place to Work in 2023) that truly cares about our people - That’s why we offer best-in-class benefits and perks that will support you and your family. In addition to our health and financial plans, we also offer:

* Paid Parental Leave
* United Compassion Fund
* Employee Discount Program
* Career Development & Promotional Opportunities
* Additional Vacation Buy Up Program (US Only)
* Early Wage Access through Payactiv (US Hourly Only)
* Paid Sick Leave
* An inclusive and welcoming culture


Learn more about our full US benefit offerings here.


Mutual respect for the dignity and fundamental rights of all persons defines our culture. United Rentals, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and makes employment decisions regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, genetic information, citizenship status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or any other status protected by law. If you need a reasonable accommodation at any point of the application process, please email careers@ur.com for assistance.


United Rentals consists of a wide variety of roles with different duties and responsibilities. The actual pay rate offered to candidates varies depending upon a wide range of factors including specific position, education, training, experience, skills, and ability.

title: SETSS Provider
description:
Join EDopt to be a part of a dedicated team that is working to advance the education and development of Elementary and High School students with IESPs.



EDopt’s mission is to provide state-of-the-art methods and educational systems to give every child in our care the support they need by equipping the providers with guidance and training opportunities.



Due to vast growth, we are looking for SETSS providers who are compassionate and enthusiastic independent professionals.



Our services are provided in school and after-school programs.

 **As a valued provider, your responsibilities will include:**


* Designing and implementing education plans for students to succeed in their learning environment
* Collaborating with families and a multi-disciplinary team to establish goals and outcomes for each child in your care
* Maintaining accurate documentation in accordance with state and city regulations
* Conducting essential evaluations and producing comprehensive reports that meet district standards
* Taking part in all meetings associated with your students

  


**Benefits:**


* Access to numerous training opportunities, support, and guidance
* Allotment for educational supplies and materials
* Flexibility to create your own schedule
* Competitive compensation package with enhanced rates
* Sick-time accrual
* End-of-Year bonus with completion of assignments

  



Join EDopt and make a positive impact on the lives of our students.

title: Part-Time STEM Teaching Artist (Training Provided)
description:
*Want to get paid to learn lego robotics?*

  




Vision Education & Media dba Robofun provides exciting, hands-on after school programs using emerging technologies for PK-12th grade youth. We ignite kids’ passion to explore and solve problems as they learn to invent, build, code, and troubleshoot. We believe learning should be fun!

  




Robofun seeks people with an interest in tech to guide our students as they grow into innovative critical thinkers. As a Robofun teacher, you will support kids as they design, code, create, and troubleshoot lego robots, video games, animations, and more. We encourage you to supplement our comprehensive project-based curriculum with creative activities of your own. You will lead small after school clubs of 12 students or fewer on adventures they will never forget! We also have opportunities to teach on weekends and during the academic day for our strongest instructors.

  




**Key Responsibilities:**


* Teach 2+ after school clubs a week (Monday to Friday) in Manhattan, Brooklyn, the Bronx, Queens, or Staten Island with the option to teach summer camp and on school breaks
* Help students develop and code cool projects including robots and video games
* Master our curriculum and technologies through paid trainings and independent study
* Maintain regular communication with managers
* Supplement our curriculum with your own creative ideas

  


**Requirements:**


* Teaching experience either in a traditional school environment or within non-traditional learning environments like coaching or camp counseling
* Availability to commit to teaching a minimum of 2 after school clubs a week for the semester
* Proficiency with computer software, a love of tinkering, and a desire to learn new technology
* Enthusiasm about working with diverse groups of NYC students
* Ability to fulfill compliance requirements including a background check by the NYC Department of Education
* Ability to provide proof of Covid-19 Vaccination

  


**Benefits:**


* Pay is hourly and commensurate with experience
* Our clubs are limited to 12 students or less so you can foster real learning and success
* You will receive paid training on how to teach emerging technologies
* Our enthusiastic, knowledgeable staff are here to support you
* We do our best to match you with age levels, locations, and clubs that best suit you
* You will become part of a collaborative culture of creative master teachers
* You will laugh and learn a lot while instilling a love of problem solving in your students

title: Part-Time STEM Teaching Assistant
description:
*Want to get paid to learn lego robotics?*

  




Vision Education & Media dba Robofun provides exciting, hands-on after school programs using emerging technologies for PK-12th grade youth. We ignite kids’ passion to explore and solve problems as they learn to invent, build, code, and troubleshoot. We believe learning should be fun!

  




Robofun seeks people with an interest in tech to guide our students as they grow into innovative critical thinkers. As a Robofun TA, you will help kids as they design, code, create, and troubleshoot lego robots, video games, animations, and more. You will support your lead teacher and students on creative adventures they will never forget! Many of our best lead teachers begin as TAs with us. This position is a great way to get comfortable in the classroom and learn skills that will help you to excel in a teaching career.

  




**Key Responsibilities:**


* Assist in after school clubs in Manhattan, Brooklyn, the Bronx, Queens, or Staten Island with the option to also TA during summer camp, on school breaks, and on events like birthday parties
* Help students develop and code cool projects including robots and video games
* Learn our curriculum and technologies through trainings and independent study
* Maintain regular communication with teachers and managers
  


**Requirements:**


* Experience working with the youth either in a traditional school environment or within non-traditional learning environments like coaching or camp counseling
* Availability to commit to teaching a minimum of 1 after school clubs a week for the semester
* Proficiency with computer software, a love of tinkering, and a desire to learn new technology
* Enthusiasm about working with diverse groups of NYC students
* Ability to fulfil compliance requirements including a background check by the NYC Department of Education if over 18
* Ability to provide proof of Covid-19 Vaccination

  


**Benefits:**


* Pay is hourly and commensurate with experience
* Our goal is to train you to become a lead teacher yourself!

title: HR Generalist
description:
**We are hiring!**

  


*For over 25 years, Forever Cheese has been a leading importer of cheese and specialty food, sourcing exceptional products from Italy, Spain, Portugal, and Croatia. The company also welcomed W.A. Imports – an importer, manufacturer, and distributor of premium Asian specialty foods to the Forever Cheese family in 2023.*

  


*Passion gives us purpose. We are energized by our work in the world of food—the discovery of products, the combinations of flavors, the sharing of recipes, the stories of our suppliers, the growth of our employees and the success of our customers.*

  


*Nobody gets us like our community. We believe in the power of food to open minds, spark adventure and bring diverse people together.*

  


*Education is what we do. We are proud to be food nerds. From product origins and creator stories to product care and knowledge, to storage, serving, and tasting—we bring our products to a wider audience, inspiring an interest and appreciation for the diversity of flavors and cultures that our products represent.*

  



We’re looking for an enthusiastic, solution-oriented, and self-motivated individual to join us. Please consider us if you'd like to:


* Work in a dynamic environment with a chance to make an impact
* Develop lasting relationships with great people
* Have the opportunity to build a satisfying career


We strongly encourage your application, as we value the perspective, experience and potential that you could bring to Forever Cheese. Get in touch and join us on our journey!

  


**About the Role**



The **Human Resources Generalist** will play an essential role in supporting our organization's multi-site human resource functions. This individual will perform exceptionally well as both an integral member of a team and as an individual contributor. The ideal candidate will be a results-oriented, driven individual with a keen eye for detail and a demonstrated ability to prioritize, plan, and execute under pressure.

  



This position is full-time exempt at our Secaucus, NJ warehouse with expected travel to/from the NYC office as needed. The HR team currently supports our office in NYC, warehouse in NJ and manufacturing plant in IL along with remote employees in various states.

  


**Responsibilities**

  



Benefit Administration & Payroll Support:


* Support and manage employee benefit programs including health insurance, retirement plans, and other fringe benefits.
* Collaborate with the finance team to resolve payroll discrepancies and issues.
* Conduct monthly reviews of payroll deductions and adjustments to ensure accuracy.
* Support our open enrollment processes, communicate benefit plan options, and address employee benefit inquiries.
* Oversee the administration and utilization of our human capital management platform, BambooHR
* Act as an advocate for team members to support resolution on any issues and support future benefit enhancements.

  



Learning & Development:


* Support the performance review process, including training on goal setting, performance feedback, and development planning.
* Support the development of training programs to enhance team members’ knowledge and skills in alignment with business objectives.

  



Recruitment:


* Collaborate with hiring managers to understand staffing needs and develop recruitment strategies.
* Assist in the development of job descriptions and position requisition approvals.
* Source candidates, screen resumes, conduct interviews, and facilitate the selection process.
* Design and implement an effective onboarding program to ensure new hires are integrated smoothly into the organization.

  



HR Administration:


* Maintain accurate and up-to-date employee records and files.

Assist with regulatory and company policy compliance related to labor laws, benefits, our team member handbook, and customer requirements.  
* 

  

**What you will bring to this role:**


* BS/BA degree in Human Resources or related field or minimum of 5 years HR experience, required
* 0-3 years of experience in HR with exposure to all major functional areas of HR, required
* In-depth knowledge of labor law and HR best practices, required
* PHR/SPHR SHRM-CP/SHRM-SCP certification is a plus
* Competent with or the ability to quickly learn the organization’s HRIS
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite
* Detail-oriented with excellent organizational and time management skills
* Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization
* Able to exhibit a high level of confidentiality
  


The HR Generalist position offers an opportunity to contribute to a dynamic and collaborative team environment while playing a key role in supporting the growth and success of our growing business. If you are passionate about people and thrive in a fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply.

  


**Our Benefits**


* Robust healthcare offerings: medical, dental, vision, telehealth, FSA and HSA plans
* Company Paid life and disability insurance
* Paid Parental Leave
* Roth and Pre-tax 401(k) options including an employer match
* Generous paid time off policies, including vacation, holiday and sick days

  


*This job description is not meant to be an all-inclusive list of duties, responsibilities and requirements, but constitutes a general definition of the position's scope and function within our company. Forever Cheese, LLC reserves the right to amend and change duties, responsibilities, and requirements to meet changing industry or business needs as necessary*

title: On-Site Retoucher, Color Correction
description:
**Job Description & Person Specification**



On-Site Retoucher, Color Correction

  

**Location: ON SITE - 75 Varick Street, 3rd Floor, New York, NY 10017**

 **Manager: Retouching Manager**

 **Employment Statu**s: **Full Time**

 **POSITION SUMMARY**

  

Our Retouchers are an integral part of Splashlight’s Revenue Growth Engine. Your primary responsibilities and tasks will support Splashlight’s core corporate goals: Implementing Business Operating Systems, Strengthening Market Position and Grow Revenue.



We are seeking an On-Site Retoucher to color-match e-commerce photography. The Retoucher will work with the Retouching Manager to learn and follow the retouching workflow and deliver images within the specified turnaround time.

 **PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES & TASKS**

  

* Color-match still life and model photography
* Achieve the client’s quality standards for e-commerce imagery
* Use our asset management tool to download and upload photos
* Fix file names when necessary to adhere to naming conventions
* Multitask in a fast paced work environment
* Perform other related duties that may arise
* Be proactive to foresee, flag, and help resolve any related problems
* Promptly notify the Retouching Manager of any issues
* Maintain confidentiality per the signed agreement

  


**EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS**

  

* 2+ years of e-commerce retouching experience, including skin, garment, and product clean up, color matching, compositing, masking, resizing, and file organization
* Keen eye and aesthetic
* Proactive and able to show initiative to foresee and resolve problems related to imagery
* Proven ability to work to strict deadlines in a fast-paced environment
* Maintain confidentiality as per the signed Restrictive Covenants and IP Protection

  



QUALIFICATIONS AND PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES

  

* Ability to learn and work quickly and efficiently
* Ability to work collaboratively to deliver high-quality imagery
* Pleasant, professional attitude
* Artistic sensibility
* Strong eye for detail
* Strong organizational skills

  



PERKS & CULTURE

  



Splashlight offers a competitive salary and benefits package including:

  

* Medical, Dental, Vision, Long and Short term Disability, Life Insurance
* 401K with matching
* Commuter and Flex Spending
* 22 PTO days & 9 paid holidays
* Pet-friendly environment
* 60,000 square feet of upbeat, stylish studio space

  



Our culture is founded in partnership, collaboration, and respect internally & externally.

  

We work as a team, win as a team, and help one another.

  

Our team’s mantra - When you are strong, we are strong. Because *you* are Splashlight.

  

**Supplemental Application:** **https://forms.gle/SdxqnVY5EjSMBZMC6**

 **EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT**

  



Splashlight is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: Splashlight is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Splashlight are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, past or present military service, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Splashlight will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics.

 **About Us:**

  



Founded in 2002, Splashlight (www.splashlight.com) is an innovative and industry-leading visual content partner providing strategy, creative direction, and production of photography and digital video services to the largest players in the fashion and retail industry. Splashlight has helped to perfect the e-commerce, catalog, and marketing content of many of the most successful brands in America. Current innovations include new enhancements that help clients improve the quality and performance of their visual content by using advanced measurement analytics. Splashlight has built a reputation for the finest fashion photography & video. Join us at the helm of eCommerce’s high velocity & max volume world. Splashlight is headquartered in New York City.

title: Product Development Assistant - Intimate Apparel
description:
Dana-co, a leading design company of luxury intimate apparel, is looking for **Product Development Assistant**.  



  

This person reports to the Senior Manager of Product Development, and they support the PD team in executing the product life cycle through accurate data entry, timely follow-up, and sample management.

  

This position works at least 4 days in our office in New York City and can work 1 day remotely.

 **Responsibilities:**

  

* Proto tracking and log-in of samples
* Create SMS request charts, tracking, and follow-up of samples
* Responsible to process all incoming SMS and pass off to the Merchandising team
* Create and update initial color breakdowns for all product offered for each market
* Create color pitch sheets for new seasonal prints and request artwork and strike-offs from vendors
* Create and maintain seasonal color binders
* Arrange and distribute color standards to factories and vendors for SMS & labdips
* Responsible for all labdip requests, follow-up and tracking. Send initial labdip comments as needed.
* Arrange and distribute seasonal fabric swatches to Merchandising
* Assist with seasonal fabric boards as needed
* Prepare and distribute mid-spec/bulk yardage to factories and HKO for adopted styles
* Maintain and organize labdips and color standards for pass-off to the bulk Color team
* Responsible to order and pick up color standards as needed and keeping detailed records
* Schedule and set up supplier meetings. Attend meetings and take notes on hanger selections and discussion points.
* Follow-up with vendors on items requested. Log in hangers received and request all pertinent information
* Responsible to review SMS invoices and pass-off to manager for approval
* Responsible to update and maintain master record of all styles adopted
* Responsible for maintaining dropped labdip binders
* Assist with organizing and maintaining the fabric and trim library
* Assist with sending packages to factories/vendors/HKO as needed
* Assist with special projects as needed

  


**Qualifications:**

  


* Bachelor’s Degree in Product Development or related field preferred
* 1-2 years of Product Development experience in the apparel industry (intimates a plus)
* Strong organizational skills and detail-oriented
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment
* Adaptable and flexible
* Enthusiastic team player with a willingness to learn and take direction
* Proficient with Microsoft Outlook, Excel, and Teams

  


**Benefits for full-time employees include:**


* Health, vision, and dental insurance
* Flexible spending accounts
* Paid Vacation, Sick, Personal time
* Paid Holidays
* 401(k) with a company match
* Parental leave (non-birthing parents included)
* Short-term disability
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* Bereavement Support
* Education Reimbursement
* Voluntary benefits include term life insurance, short term disability, AD&D, critical illness, hospital indemnity, accident insurance, and group legal services
* Employee discounts
  


**Equal Opportunity Statement:**



Dana-co is an inclusive equal opportunity employer committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse workforce. We provide a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment based upon any legally protected characteristic, including, but not limited to, an individual’s sex, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity, or pregnancy.

 **Full Time: Monday to Friday, 40 hours per week**

 **Work Location: In-office 4 days and remote 1 day**

title: Project Manager
description:
**Summary:**

Esposito Construction is seeking an experienced, self-motivated Project Manager. The right candidate should be well versed in utility pipe construction process and all that it entails. The right candidate must be able to manage utility crews and supervise the day-to-day activities involving water main, sewer main, and storm sewer. Schedule and facilitate the resources needed to complete a construction project along with job cost control, quality control to help set and maintain the project budget.



Applicant must be a strong leader to accurately communicate, manage, and execute construction projects has brought Esposito Construction to great success, and we are looking for the right candidate to continue to drive that success.

  

**Benefits:**


* Medical Insurance paid by Esposito Construction for single rate.
* 401(k) eligibility with company contribution.
* Dental insurance eligibility.
* Vision insurance eligibility.
* Paid time off.
* Pay: Flexible based upon Experience

  

  

**Supplemental Pay:**  

Performance based bonuses.  

Retention plans.

  

**Responsibilities:**


* Create schedules for jobs and coordinate with subcontractors.
* Assist with take-off for material ordering.
* Leading job meetings including pre-construction, project, staff meetings.
* Accurately assess design requirements, materials list, and field productivity.
* Ability to comprehend the subtleties of project specifications and proposal forms.
* Demonstrate appropriate people skills to facilitate smooth operation of the estimate and project.
* This position will oversee multiple crews for the installation of all underground utilities (water, storm, and sewer) on heavy civil construction projects
* Instill Safety as a top priority
* Provides on-site supervision and direction to foreman
* Familiar with project specifications and ability to understand plans
* Establish and adjust work sequences to meet schedule, using knowledge of capacities of equipment and assigned personnel
* Analyze daily foreman reports
* Analyze and resolve issues that may arise
* Ability to explain and understand survey and grade staking (Lasers, Transits, and GPS) to help advise and direct crews
* Other duties may be assigned

  


**Qualifications:**


* 5 years as a pipe foreman and 5 years as a superintendent in the civil utility construction
* OSHA 30 required and competent person certified
* Must be able to operate heavy equipment & hold a DOT Medical Certificate
* Ability to work outside in all weather conditions
* Ability to work with tools and equipment including power and non-power tools
* Frequently sit, stand, walk, crouch, kneel, climb and periodically lift up to 50lbs
* Positive attitude and possess excellent motivational skills
* Time management, multitasking, and prioritization are crucial
* Good attention to detail with the ability to recognize discrepancies
* Must possess good communication and organizational skills
* Must be paperwork and computer literate
* Must have the ability to read and interpret design drawings
* Must be able to look ahead and plan accordingly
* Must possess the ability to communicate in a positive manner with owners, engineers, employees, and coworkers
* Must possess the ability to manage multiple crews of tradesmen and laborers
* Must have fluent knowledge of sewer main and lift station installation
* Must have fluent knowledge of deep trench excavation
* Must have an understanding of line and grade and be able to operate a transit, pipe laser, and other trade required instruments.
* Proficiency in Word, Excel, Project, and Outlook.
* Understanding of construction terminology, material types and ability to communicate effectively within the construction environment.
* In depth knowledge of construction methods and means and equipment utilization.
* Bachelor's (Preferred).

  


*Esposito Construction LLC is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age*
company_addresses: 24 Merchants way Suite 109 Colts Neck, NJ
company_description: Esposito Construction’s comprised of top-quality engineers, project managers, operators, laborers, and safety professionals. focused on completing every construction project with efficiency & Safety.

title: Heavy Equipment Operator (Utilities)
description:
**Summary:**



Esposito Construction is seeking an *Equipment Operator* with field experience for various job sites across the state. Specifically we are looking for team members in North NJ. Candidates must have experience running loaders, dozers, excavators and various other machines. Candidates must also have knowledge of site work, earth moving, and utilities installation. Experience with pipe and/or utility work is a plus. We are seeking someone who is motivated, hands-on, self-starter with a proven track record.

 **Benefits:**


* Medical Insurance paid by Esposito Construction for single rate.
* 401(k) eligibility with company contribution.
* Dental insurance eligibility.
* Vision insurance eligibility.
* Paid time off.
* Pay: Flexible, experience based

  


**Responsibilities:**


* Operate heavy equipment including excavators, bulldozers, loaders, and trenchers to perform site grading, excavation, and trenching for underground utilities.
* Safely and efficiently maneuver machinery to excavate and backfill trenches, ensuring proper depth and alignment according to project plans and specifications.
* Install underground utilities such as water lines, sewer pipes, and drainage systems, while adhering to established standards and regulations.
* Collaborate with project managers, supervisors, and fellow crew members to coordinate work activities and ensure project deadlines are met.
* Conduct routine maintenance checks on equipment to ensure proper functioning and address any mechanical issues promptly.
* Adhere to all safety protocols and guidelines to prevent accidents and ensure a safe working environment for yourself and others.
* Maintain accurate records of work performed, including equipment usage, materials used, and project progress

  


**Qualifications:**


* Must be able to work in team setting
* Pipe experience preferred but not required
* Knowledge of safety procedures and regulations related to excavation and trenching operations.
* Previous experience operating heavy equipment, specifically for site work and underground utilities.
* OSHA 10 and/or 30 Preferred

  


**Physical Requirements:**


* Ability to sit for long periods while operating machinery.
* Capable of getting in and out of the machine multiple times throughout the day.
* Comfortable climbing up and down steps or ladders of the equipment.
* Physically capable to work on your feet and lift/move material productively
* Ability to withstand exposure to outdoor elements such as heat, cold, and precipitation.
* Good hand-eye coordination and manual dexterity.
* Physical stamina and strength to perform tasks consistently throughout the day.
* The job may require working outdoors in various weather conditions.
* May involve exposure to loud noise, vibrations, and dust.

  


*Esposito Construction LLC is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age*

title: Wealth Advisor, Managing Director
description:
Since 2004, BakerAvenue has guided clients through personal and professional transitions. Our firm provides comprehensive wealth management and investment expertise for high-net-worth individuals, families, trusts, foundations, and endowments. Driven by our purpose, we strive to make a positive impact on society alongside financial return. We are headquartered in San Francisco with offices in New York, Dallas, Houston, Seattle, San Diego, Sun Valley, and Naples.

  

At BakerAvenue, we care about our people and believe in the importance of personal connections and collaborative efforts. Our success is driven by the relationships we form with our colleagues and clients. Our values of community, excellence, trust, and inclusion are at the heart of everything we do. These values are our inspiration for how we serve our clients, employees, and the community we share.

  

BakerAvenue is proud to be recognized by leading companies and organizations for our commitment to excellence. Our award-winning culture has maintained our Great Place to Work certification, and we have earned our Diversio certification for our efforts to elevate diversity & inclusion. As a company committed to sustainability, we are honored to be a certified B Corporation and a signatory of Principles of Responsible Investment (PRI).

  

The Role:

  

We are seeking a Wealth Advisor. Our Wealth Advisors are committed to being part of a team that delivers comprehensive wealth management solutions and provides outstanding service to prospects, clients, and partners.

  

The Wealth Advisor will also be responsible for providing portfolio management and financial planning guidance through phone conversations, email, and face-to-face meetings with our clients. Wealth Advisors are assigned existing and new BakerAvenue clients with the primary goal of building long-term relationships and growing AUM through client referrals, consolidation and referrals from COIs. The Wealth Advisor will also be responsible for developing channels externally to ensure a flow of qualified potential clients. These channels will include the Fidelity Wealth Advisor Solutions Referral Program, Schwab Advisor Network Referral Program, CPAs, Attorneys, and other business channels and COIs. Experience and knowledge of Fidelity and Schwab branch advisory networks and the associated referral programs will also be critical to the success of this role.

  

The position is based out of our New York office.

  

Responsibilities:

  

* Deliver tailored investment and comprehensive wealth management solutions to clients by collaborating with strategic partners to design, implement and manage their portfolio
* Assess client’s overall financial picture, understand their needs and develop a solid financial plan and portfolio strategy
* Prepare customized proposals for clients and prospective clients
* Assists in the development of complex and highly customized financial portfolios
* Collaborate with the Advisor and Investment Management Committee to deliver investment recommendations
* Develop asset allocations to meet clients’ risk profile and time horizon
* Knowledge of key financial, investment and risk management concepts to be able to lead client meetings
* Co-manage and provide leadership within the team
* Network with Fidelity and Schwab channel personnel to develop a stream of qualified potential clients
* Prospecting to cultivate new business through various channels (Custodial Referral Programs, existing and new COI professionals, etc.)
* Coordinate seamless transitions and onboarding of new clients to BakerAvenue Wealth Advisory
* Conduct branch marketing meetings and training for the advisors of our custodial partners

  

Qualifications:

  

* 10–15+ years in client facing advisory roles. Concentrations in wealth management, financial, estate planning, and/or tax related work
* Demonstrated business development track record in captive custodial channels
* CFP® required. Other credentials a plus
* 4-year college degree with a preferred emphasis in economics, business, finance, accounting or similar field
* Very strong knowledge of finance and capital markets required
* Technical expertise in financial planning, retirement planning, investment management and cash flow/capital needs planning analysis
* A passion for financial planning & growing. We look for highly motivated candidates with a strong desire to deliver successfully, learn new skills, assume additional responsibilities and advance their career
* Strong abilities to multi-task, manage various client requests and effectively prioritize
* Unquestioned commitment to integrity in personal and professional activities
* Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team environment
* Confidence to work directly with senior leaders and high-net worth clients

  



Benefits:

  

* Medical / Dental / Vision / Life / Disability Insurance
* High-deductible plan option with health savings account
* Employee assistance program
* Wellness allowance – $75 monthly
* Bereavement leave – 3 days paid for immediate family member or pet
* 401k with 3% match
* Commuter benefits
* Parental bonding leave – up to 100% of salary for 12 weeks
* Donation match – up to $500 annually
* Birthday PTO
* Learning and Development stipend – up to $1000 annually
* Volunteer PTO – 1 day per quarter
* Monthly cell phone allowance – $75 monthly

  


*BakerAvenue Wealth Management's commitment to equal opportunity employment applies to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits unlawful discrimination and harassment of any type on the basis of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.*

title: Associate Wealth Advisor - Hybrid Work
description:
While the public is generally uninformed and confused about the differences between those who call themselves financial advisors, we understand the clear distinction between firms who sell a product and those who provide professional advice. If you are passionate about financial planning and want to deliver life changing advice by working side by side with clients (instead of constantly trying to sell them a product or the next “hot” investment) we invite you to learn more about Novi Wealth Partners.

  



Novi Wealth is an independent, fee-only, comprehensive wealth management firm. The culture of our firm is centered around our clients and what is best for them. We have a collaborative environment where advisors learn from and support one another to deliver an exceptional client experience. As our firm grows, we want to ensure we have enough planners in place to continually deliver on the service expectations we have promised to our clients. Currently, we have an opening for an Associate Wealth Advisor to join our team. We welcome candidates who are passionate about continuous learning and we are committed to the growth and development of our team members by offering pathways to becoming Wealth Advisors and potentially future partners.

  



The following is a list of what is expected of an Associate Wealth Advisor at Novi.

  


**Core Values for every employee**

  


* The desire to deliver **excellence** in everything you do.
* Embrace **integrity** and high moral standards.
* Employ an **entrepreneurial** mindset; be creative, motivated and adaptable.
* Be **humble** in your dealings, knowledge without having all the answers.
* Approach people and situations with **empathy** and curiosity.

  


**Position-Specific Standards**

  



Client meetings


* Attend client meetings and capture the details of their planning needs, current circumstances, and action items
* Provide meeting summary emails to clients upon request
* Serve as the primary contact for data gathering for new clients
* Review data as it is received and enter the information into our planning software and storage folders
* Review and discuss data and assumptions with lead advisor and assist with development of financial planning recommendations
* Conduct investment analysis of existing holdings and help prepare an investment plan to present to clients
* Analyze risk tolerance of each client and provide feedback to lead advisor
* Review prior client meeting notes and correspondence to develop discussion points
* Prepare core planning deliverables per agenda for review by lead advisor
* Prepare advanced planning recommendations for review by lead advisor as assigned
* Maintain client files to ensure they are organized and up to date
* Eventually serve as lead or servicing advisor for new clients based on their service offering and classification

  




Investment management


* Classify new securities in reporting software
* Reconcile trades
* Assist lead advisor with development of investment plans for clients
* Implement investment plans for clients by setting up and maintaining settings (cash management, hold do not trade, etc.) in our trading software
* Monitor client accounts for trading opportunities (cash management, tax trading, rebalancing, etc.) and propose trades to lead advisor
* Review quarterly performance reports for accuracy and action items
* Develop and present Investment Policy Statements (IPS) to clients
* Present investment education slides to clients

  



Other


* Ensure Required Minimum Distributions (RMDs) are satisfied each year and assign distribution requests to operations team as needed.
* Coordinate between the lead advisor and the operations team to ensure timely processing of all action items.
* Interact with client’s attorneys and accountants on plan implementation
* Ensure IRA and retirement plan contributions are made in a timely manner
* Provide backup support to operations by assisting with fielding all incoming phone calls
* Create income tax projections and determine proper IRA tax withholding for federal and state taxes
* Create income tax projections and evaluate the potential for Roth IRA conversions
* Assist with all non-operational customer service questions from clients
* Responsible for facilitating (not processing) distribution requests from clients (entering into CRM to start workflow, determining account, tax withholding, frequency, ACH/Wire, etc.)
* Participate in internal committees as assigned
* Review forms prepared by operations to ensure accuracy as needed

  


**Education Requirements**


* Bachelor’s degree required
* Must possess the Series 65 license (or able to pass within 90 days of hire)
* Completed some of the CFP® curriculum or undergrad with CFP® coursework preferred
* 2-3 years previous experience in a professional environment preferred.
* We recognize that experience comes in many forms and encourage candidates with diverse backgrounds and experiences to apply.

  



Novi Wealth is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified individuals without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identify, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law.

  



At Novi Wealth, we believe in making a positive impact on our clients' lives and our community. We seek team members who are motivated by the opportunity to contribute meaningfully to both.

  



At Novi Wealth we value our employees and our benefits are designed to support the diverse needs of our team. They include a generous retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare and Paid Time Off (PTO).

  


**"Empowering all to find their definition of wealth, while providing the confidence to achieve it."**

title: Retention Specialist
description:
POSITION OVERVIEW:



The People Operations Manager will manage and monitor the agency’s performance standards; analyze performance data, evaluate employee performance by using BambooHR; conduct statistical performance analysis, participate in the development of training materials as well as hiring standards. Assist in hiring, training, conduct interviews to help hiring managers to select the best talent. Create, develop, implement, and conduct training programs for the organization’s employees. Assess the organization’s developmental needs to drive training initiatives, identifies, and arranges suitable training solutions for employees. Maintain an effective program for retention, promotion and succession planning.

  

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS:


* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Training and Development, or a related field required. At least two years of training experience required.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Strong presentation skills.
* Adept with a variety of multimedia training platforms and methods.
* Ability to evaluate and research training options and alternatives.
* Ability to design and implement effective training and development.
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite and related program software.
* Bilingual in Spanish, Cantonese, or Mandarin a plus

  



RESPONSIBILITIES:


* Implement and administer semi-annual Performance Review using BambooHR that evaluate measure, enhance and improve employee performance.
* Utilize assessments to evaluate and identify the current and emerging skills, competencies, and behaviors required to achieve desired organizational results.
* Assess training and develop needs through surveys, interviews, focus groups, and communication with managers
* Create, organize, plan, and present various forms of onboarding, orientation, and skills training for employees.
* Develop unique training programs to fulfill workers’ specific needs to maintain or improve job skills.
* Create and/or acquire training procedure manuals, guides, and course materials.
* Assist in developing, initiating and maintaining effective programs for workforce retention, promotion and succession planning.
* Manage the maintenance and execution of the performance management system, including current job descriptions, standards of performance and performance evaluation instruments.
* Create and maintain an environment of equal employment opportunity, diversity and competitive advantage in support of the company's diversity and inclusion strategic plan.
* Present training and development programs using various forms and formats including group discussion, lecture, simulations, and videos.
* Maintain records of training and development activities, attendance, results of tests and assessments, and retraining requirements.
* Train and coaches managers, supervisors and others involved in employee development efforts.
* Evaluate program effectiveness through assessments, surveys, and feedback.
* Maintain knowledge of the latest trends in training and development.
* Prepare and implement training budget; maintains records and reports of expenses.
* Work effectively as a team member with other members of management and the HR staff.
* Assist the HR department with planning & preparing of various events
* Engage in professional development and apply learned knowledge towards using evidence-based best practices
* Engage in data analysis processes conducted by the Evaluation and Quality team to determine strengths and areas for improvement and follow action steps in the Continuous Quality Improvement (CQI) process
* Perform other related duties as required.

  



WORKING CONDITIONS: Typical office environment, with frequent travel to multiple Hudson Guild sites. Requires frequent sitting, standing, walking, talking, hearing & reaching. Occasional stooping, crouching, and kneeling.

  

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: Position requires frequent communication with participants, management, and staff. Frequently remain in a stationary position, as well as operate a computer and other office machinery, such as phone and copy machine. Occasionally lift up to 20 lbs.

  

As a full time employee at Hudson Guild, you will be eligible for:


* 24 Vacation Days
* 1 Floating Holiday

* Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
* 403b Plan

title: Program Director School Age Program
description:
**POSITION OVERVIEW:** Under the supervision of the Deputy Executive Director, the Program Director oversees all daily operations of programs while maintaining a warm, challenging and nurturing environment. The Program Director is responsible for programming, safety, staffing, and administrative tasks. These tasks include, but are not limited to, enrollment, outreach and curriculum. The Program Director will also take on the role of facilitating various on-going activities and family engagements for the year-round program for participating children and their families. The Program Director is responsible for working closely with staff, parents, local elementary schools and community partners.

  


**QUALIFICATIONS:** A Bachelor’s degree in Education, Social Work, or other related field. Master’s Degree preferred. Minimum of two years’ experience working in an after school and/or camp setting for middle school aged youth. Significant experience in program planning, administration, monitoring and evaluation. Strong organizational, communication and supervisory skills. Significant experience in city, state and federal contract management.

  


**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:** Have extensive knowledge of age appropriate skill development strategies for students. Experience working with youth from diverse backgrounds with a variety of academic/skill levels.Proficiency in Microsoft Office programs. Bilingual preferred (Spanish).

  


**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

  


*Programmatic and Administrative*

  


* Plan, develop, implement, and evaluate programs and activities that prepare youth for success while promoting safety and program quality
* Design and implement innovative and age appropriate curriculums, enrichment activities, and theme-based projects taking into consideration youth needs, interest and abilities.
* Analyze service delivery strategies and develop continuous improvement plans for program success.
* Collect and document all objectives, outcomes, student data and other information as needed in reports to various stakeholders.
* Demonstrate flexibility and ability to manage challenging situations, including helping to monitor and supervise students during the afterschool program.
* Manage budget, process payroll and submit requests in accordance with fiscal policies and program needs.
* Organize exciting functions such as special events, performances, parent events, field trips, etc.
* Develop and maintain relationships/communication with families, school principals, DOE staff, community organizations, funding agencies, resource organizations, program partners and any other stakeholders.
* Maintain routine contact with principals, teachers, afterschool staff and volunteers to discuss issues, challenges and opportunities for collaboration

  


*Staffing and Compliance*

  


* Provide consistent supervision and training for staff in child/youth development, program regulations, child care laws and other related topics. Conduct regular staff meetings.
* Ensure compliance with all DOH, DYCD and other funding sources/contractual regulations. Maintain up to date organized document binders as well as oversight of online data systems and their deadlines. (Attendance, reports, action plans, work scope, etc.)
* Report incidents immediately and refer appropriate staff issues to the HR Dept. Implement and reinforce protocols and procedures.
* Monitor all contract compliance, including enrollment and rate of participation compliance.
* Collaborate internal Hudson Guild departments to identify measurable targets and goals for your program, and ensure processes are in place to collect and submit data in a timely manner to meet funder and organizational requirements
* Be accountable and hold staff accountable for implementing programs with fidelity, utilizing evidence-based practices whenever possible
* Engage in ongoing Continuous Quality Improvement (CQI) to evaluate program data, determine strengths and areas for improvement and execute action steps to make improvements
* Collaborate with, assist in and do outreach at all Community Building activities to build and maintain external and internal partnerships that can benefit both participants and community members
* Responsible for ongoing communication and follow-up with community partners
* Perform other duties as assigned

  


**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:** Occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds and frequently operate a computer keyboard, mouse, & other office equipment.

  

As a full time employee at Hudson Guild, you will be eligible for:


* 24 Vacation Days
* 1 Floating Holiday
* 12 Sick Days
* Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
* 403b Plan

  



Hudson Guild is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: New Sales Executive (Remote US)
description:
Alessa envisions a world free from financial crime, delivering transformative SaaS solutions in KYC, AML, and fraud prevention. We help clients reduce risk, save money, and grow their business while ensuring seamless compliance. Our robust tools identify high-risk entities early, enabling swift investigation and remediation to meet regulatory demands. Trusted by financial institutions, MSBs, casinos, and corporates across various sectors, Alessa empowers organizations to stay ahead in fraud detection and compliance.

  

We’ve recently launched new and exciting technology that is changing the compliance industry, and we want your help to tell the world.

  



Alessa is currently looking for an experienced **New Sales Executive** to join our Sales Team. In this hunter role, you will drive new business with a focus on growing Alessa’s revenue stream through the acquisition of new sales logos. This will include prospecting into financial institutions of varying sizes and non-financially regulated firms.

  

The New Sales Executive will be responsible for researching clients, generating leads and working with prospects throughout the entire sales process - from initial discovery meeting through close. Your performance will be measured on your ability to meet and exceed quarterly and annual territory and company sales growth targets. **This is a remote position that can be located anywhere in the United States.**

 **Responsibilities:**


* Navigate each stage of the sales cycle from qualification to close.
* Develop, cultivate, source and mine lead lists within assigned territory.
* Conduct outbound sales activities including cold calls, emails, and LinkedIn messaging.
* Work closely with marketing to implement business development initiatives.
* Qualify new opportunities and marketing leads and deliver Alessa’s value proposition through client meetings, demos, in-market events, and other account-based activities.
* Work in tandem with Alessa’s Solution Consultant to define the appropriate solution for each prospect.
* Think strategically to develop and execute tactical plans and quarterly business reviews to engage and grow your assigned territory.
* Track and update opportunities in Salesforce, ensuring maintenance of excellent pipeline coverage and hygiene.
* Manage large and complex multi-faceted technical software sales and pursue opportunities to close, including all activities necessary to obtain client signature and book deals.
* Providing accurate management updates on key metrics and lead generation activities.

  


**Requirements:**


* Experienced B2B Account Executive with 2+ years of experience and success in driving new business.
* Industry experience within AML/ Fraud Detection/Risk/ Compliance Operations within financial institutions is highly desired and preferred.
* Proven ability and history of success securing new logos, including meeting and exceeding new sales quota selling an Enterprise SaaS Solution.
* Experience selling and managing a complex sales cycle with multiple stakeholders, including C-level executives, in a direct selling environment.
* Experience developing and managing a diversified pipeline with multiple leads and opportunities in varying stages.
* Driven, positive and hungry with a “never give up” outlook that enables effective management of customer rejection.
* Enthusiastic, positive, collaborative and hard-working.
* Proven ability to create go to market strategies and effectively manage a sales territory as defined by management, by building, maintaining, and maximizing a sales pipeline.
* Exceptional client relationship skills with the ability to sell and position on value rather than on “features” and “functions”.
* Intelligent, poised, creative & articulate, with excellent written communication and organizational skills.
* Growth-mindset - this is an evolving space that requires constant learning to keep yourself up to date with knowledge on industry regulations, news, and events.
* Able to work effectively and productively in independent settings both direct and in virtual teams.

  



If you are looking to make a difference and would like to help Alessa achieve its’ vision of a world free of financial crime, we would love to hear from you.

  



Alessa is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to equal treatment of all employees without regard to race, national origin, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, veteran status, physical or mental disability or other basis protected by law.

title: Per Diem/Flex Direct Support Professional
description:
**About Us:**  

Neuron Health Systems is a highly acclaimed, community-based organization consisting of acute outpatient rehabilitation and medical and non-medical direct care staff. We specialize in delivering individualized, family-centered care. By including family and caregivers in every step of the rehab process, along with an interdisciplinary approach to treatment, we give our patients every opportunity to reach their fullest potential. Neuron Health Systems is seeking a Direct Support Professional to work with individuals with developmental disabilities in their home and the local community. This is a part-time contract role. The Direct Support Professional assists Human Resources in completing projects that enable clients to be effectively served throughout their communities using data tracking, reporting, and coordination.
  
  

**Why Choose Us:**  

You chose healthcare to make an impact. At Neuron Health Systems, we inspire you to help change lives and unlock the potential of every adult and senior, every day. Our culture is driven by our community, our values, and our team.
  
  

**We are also proud to offer:**  

Employer paid benefits
  
Employee Recognition Program
  
  

As a member of the Neuron Health Systems team, your responsibilities will include:
  
  

Encouraging individuals to participate in community activities.
  
Handling general housekeeping tasks and meal preparation.
  
Assist individuals in making progress on their Outcome and Goals for the specified service as defined in their Individual Support Plan.
  
Participate in All Agency and Family Services team meetings when available.
  
Take advantage of training opportunities to improve the ability to support and promote individuals served.
  
Provide individual-specific supports as outlined in the ISP; such as personal care, behavioral intervention, communication assistance, etc.
  
Promote the holistic well-being of each individual served to assist them to achieve their own style of Belonging.
  
Transport individuals to related activities that are within the departmental mileage cap.
  
Respond appropriately to emergency situations.
  
Learn and follow agency policies/procedures and government regulations for the services provided.
  
Other related duties as assigned
  
  

We invite you to join our dynamic team of caregiver professionals to make a difference in our community and grow in your field with the support and tools of one of the region’s top rehabilitation organizations!
  
  

Get the word out!

title: Account Executive
description:
**Join Corporate Insight: Lead the Digital Transformation in Financial Services**



Are you a high-performing sales professional ready to make your mark in the financial services industry? Corporate Insight is seeking exceptional **Account Executives** to drive our growth and shape the future of digital experiences in finance.

  


**About Us**



Corporate Insight is the catalyst for digital transformation in the financial services sector. We empower industry leaders to deliver unparalleled digital customer experiences, fostering engagement, satisfaction, and loyalty. Our unique blend of deep industry knowledge, cutting-edge research, and actionable insights keeps our clients at the forefront of an increasingly competitive digital landscape.

  


**The Opportunity**



As an Account Executive at Corporate Insight, you'll:


* Manage and grow a lucrative $5 million book of business with Fortune 500 clients
* Enjoy uncapped earnings potential with a competitive base salary and commission structure
* Work in a hybrid environment, with 3 days per week in our vibrant Midtown Manhattan office

  


**Key Responsibilities**


* Develop and execute strategies to expand your $5 million book of business
* Identify and cultivate new opportunities through strategic prospecting and networking
* Build and maintain strong relationships with key decision-makers at client organizations
* Drive the full sales cycle from prospecting to contract negotiation and close
* Collaborate with internal teams to craft tailored solutions that exceed client expectations
* Leverage deep industry knowledge to stay ahead of trends and refine go-to-market strategies
* Conduct compelling demos and capability presentations, both in-person and virtually

  


**The Ideal Candidate**



We're looking for a dynamic professional with:


* 10+ years of B2B sales experience, preferably in financial services or technology
* A consistent track record of meeting and exceeding ambitious sales targets
* Experience selling to $1B+ companies and managing complex license/subscription cycles
* Exceptional communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex concepts clearly and persuasively
* Proven sales experience in market research, data analytics, and user experience solutions
* A consultative selling approach and high level of business acumen
* Proficiency in Salesforce for pipeline management and forecasting
* Bachelor's degree in Sales, Business Administration, Marketing, or related field (MBA a plus)

  


**Why Corporate Insight?**


* Be at the forefront of digital innovation in the financial services industry
* Enjoy a competitive compensation package with uncapped commission potential
* Benefit from comprehensive health coverage and performance bonuses
* Thrive in a collaborative, idea-driven environment that values your contributions
* Access unparalleled professional development and advancement opportunities


Ready to revolutionize digital experiences and set new standards of excellence in the financial sector? Join Corporate Insight and be more than a witness to industry transformation – be its driving force.

  



Apply now and take the next step in your career with Corporate Insight!

  



Corporate Insight is an equal opportunity employer. We prohibit discrimination based on race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

title: Mixed Methods UX Researcher - Short Term (Remote)
description:
***AnswerLab is looking for Short-Term Mixed Methods UX Researchers for Full-Time Temporary employment through the end of 2024. Those selected must be able to conduct remote research during this timeframe.***

  


**Who We Are:**



AnswerLab is the leading UX Research firm in the US. We help powerful brands such as Amazon, Google, Facebook, and FedEx bring a human-centered design process to every product launched. We focus on user experience research to understand what people see, do, think, and feel when using websites, mobile applications, voice interfaces, AR/VR, wearables, and other digital products. Our research studies are tailored to our clients' unique needs to provide clear, actionable recommendations that generate strategic business results.

  

The secret to our success is no secret: It is the people who work here! We recruit only the most skilled and client-focused professionals to join our team. All are devoted to being at the forefront of the user experience industry. Our team is made up of smart, down-to-earth people who value collaboration and exploring creative solutions as well as a good dose of humor during our workday. We empower them to do what they do best; lead impactful research studies from planning to analysis for the world’s most innovative brands.

 **Job Purpose & Impact**



As a Mixed Methods User Experience Researcher (UXR), you will be a key member of our quantitative and qualitative research teams, supporting research execution for our Fortune 500 clients. The successful candidate will partner and collaborate with our clients to execute full research programs and is comfortable flexing between different mixes of quantitative and qualitative methodologies. You will apply current analysis techniques to ensure client business objectives are met, while effectively communicating the results of research findings to all levels of client stakeholders. Example research methods include a mix of custom surveys, segmentation/persona research, MaxDiff/Kano, one-on-one usability studies (remote and in-person), online and in-person focus groups, exploratory research, diary studies, and quantitative benchmarking studies.

  

The ideal candidate for this role will be a UX researcher who is driven, a creative problem solver, and an excellent collaborator and communicator. You have experience conducting, analyzing, and reporting on a variety of quantitative and qualitative research methods and love to geek out about all things research. You know when and how to apply various research methods to measure users’ attitudes, motivations, and factors underlying their behaviors, in order to address our client's biggest questions. You thrive in a home-based work environment, and you are comfortable accommodating East and West Coast working hours as needed.

 **Mixed Method Researcher Responsibilities**


* Design and execute research that addresses behaviors and attitudes
* Effectively apply appropriate research methodologies based on business objectives and research goals
* Conduct research using a wide variety of methods and interpret analysis through the lens of UX, HCI, and social sciences
* Generate insights that drive tactical and strategic decisions
* Communicate insights in creative and compelling ways
* Collaborate with client teams, internal teams, vendors, and technology providers
* Partner with qualitative and quantitative UX researchers on mixed-methods programs
* Provide thought leadership in UX research
* Contribute to research team strategy within the organization
* Mentor other researchers, and maintain a high standard of work

  



We understand that outstanding candidates can come from a variety of backgrounds. While specific experience is important, we are ultimately looking for candidates who have the personal characteristics to thrive in a growing client-focused business. The ideal candidate will likely meet many or most of the job criteria listed below.

 **Minimum Qualifications**


* 3+ years of experience in quantitative and qualitative research, preferably at a consulting agency
* Experience with a variety of quantitative research methods, such as large-scale surveys, log analysis, regression analysis, behavioral clustering, multivariate testing, and basic statistics
* Experience with a variety of industry-centered qualitative research methods, such as semi-structured interviews, contextual inquiries, ethnography, usability studies, diary studies, and unmoderated remote studies
* Experience planning and executing complex research projects
* Experience managing time and prioritizing tasks across multiple projects simultaneously
* Experience with survey design using technologies such as Qualtrics, Alchemer, UserZoom, Google Forms, etc.
* Experience working with data in multi-method programs
* Experience working with descriptive and basic inferential statistics
* Experience with Q Research, DisplayR, R, SPSS, or Stata
* Experience translating research findings into strategic narratives
* Effective communication skills with experience presenting to diverse audiences
* Bachelor’s degree in a human behavior related field (HCI, Market Research, Psychology, Sociology, Economics, Computer Science, etc.) and 3+ years of relevant experience, or MA/MS/PhD in related field and 2+ years’ relevant experience

  


**AnswerLab’s Core Values:**



* Build trust


* Provide amazing service


* Support and encourage inclusivity


* Jump in to help others


* Handle change with flexibility


* Innovate our products and processes


* Explore creative solutions to challenges


* Make AnswerLab a great place to work



**Physical Requirements:**


* Overtime may be required to meet project deadlines.
* Sitting for extended periods of time.
* Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard, mouse, and other devices and objects.

  


**This is a short-term position through the end of 2024.**



No staffing/recruiting agencies, please.



We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States, however, we are not able to sponsor visas at this time.

 ***At AnswerLab, our mission is to create experiences people love. This means we strive to make our company a great place to work for people from all walks of life. Hiring people from a wide variety of backgrounds makes our company stronger and helps us achieve our mission.***

  


***We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.***

title: Medical Assistant (R6)
description:
**ABOUT THE COMPANY:** Tribeca Pediatrics was founded by Dr. Michel Cohen, in 1994, and has grown into New York City's largest and most respected primary care pediatric practice. With over 40 locations in vibrant neighborhoods throughout the New York City metro area and New Jersey, we are truly the premier place to work and bring your family. Our incredible team of pediatricians, nurse practitioners, and medical support staff practices a unique philosophy that embraces low intervention, thoughtful medicine while delivering the highest quality of service and care.

 **JOB DESCRIPTION:** Tribeca Pediatrics Medical Assistants provide direct patient care to children in a clinical setting. They communicate with the pediatricians to provide a high level of service and care. Medical assistants are responsible for administering labs, screenings, drawing up vaccines and medications. They also maintain the medical inventory and supplies of the office and ensure a clean, functional and professional work environment. Customer service and a love for children is a must.

 **ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

  

* Patient intake, measure vital signs and record patient's chief complaint in the electronic medical record system
* Maintain a friendly, supportive and professional demeanor with patients and colleagues
* Administer, prepare, and send out Laboratory specimens and vaccines
* Perform in-office lab tests (i.e. strep testing, HGB, Lead, etc.)
* Perform routine screening tests and surveys such vision screening and hearing tests
* Schedule appointments
* Maintain office logs, vaccine and supply inventories
* Adhere to practice policies around HIPAA compliance and staff and patient safety
* Complete charts and tasks accurately and in a timely manner
* Potential assignment as a trainer after 90 day review. Training bonus offered.

  


**QUALIFICATIONS**

  

* Previous experience in the medical field preferred
* Pre Med & CMA New Grads Welcome
* Warm and friendly customer service skills
* Time management skills and ability to multitask and prioritize work
* Open availability
* Must be able to provide proof of vaccination against COVID-19, Hep B, Tdap and MMR.

  


**SALARY**


* Starting rate: $20.00/hour

  


**Supporting your career development:**

  

* Join a medical community of over 300 passionate providers & support team members
* Gain exposure in the medical and customer service field
* Potential assignment as a trainer after 90 day review. Training bonus offered.

  


**Benefits to support your health & wellness:**


* + After 90 days of employment, participate in competitive medical, dental and vision insurance plans paid for by Tribeca Pediatrics **or receive an additional benefit stipend of $600.00 per year**
* 401(k) Plan with 3% Safe harbor contribution from employer each year **(employees who are eligible will receive an immediately vested contribution each year even if they do not contribute themselves to their 401K plan)**
* Accrue up to 16 days of PTO/ year with the ability to roll over unused days
* Fully paid Gym Membership to select gyms in NYC and NJ
* Employee Assistance Program - Free confidential advice for team members who need help with stress, anxiety, financial planning, and legal issues
* Pre Tax Commuter & Parking Benefit
* Additional medical coverage buy up available through Aflac
* Exclusive access to preferred pricing for Pet Insurance

  


**ENVIRONMENTAL/WORKING CONDITIONS**


* Clinical Office Environment

title: Retail Sales Associate
description:

Do you think you are our “ONE in a million” for the position of Fulltime Sales Associate at our Macys Herald SQ store? Let’s see if you have what it takes to shine! This is a Invitation only event therefore please apply to be considered !!

  

**Your Mission**


* **Exceptional Advisory:** It's not just about selling jewelry, but about creating a connection. You'll help our customers find the perfect piece, offering personalized service that exceeds their expectations.
* **Purposeful Objectives:** You'll work with KPIs, individual and group goals, where your performance will be key to our common success. We'll give you the necessary tools and celebrate every victory together.
* **Space Care**: Our store is our temple, and your role is crucial in keeping it impeccable: opening/closing, cleaning, visual merchandising, and much more. You won't get bored!
* **Product:** Every jewel has its story and deserves to be presented in its best light. You'll be responsible for its care, stock control, and support in the inventory process.

  


**What Do We Offer?**


* In addition to your hourly rate, make the most of our highly competitive commission system!
* Enjoy exclusive discounts on our jewelry, designed to dazzle.
* Employee assistance program.
* Opportunities for growth and internal development are at the heart of our culture. A perfect stage to succeed!

  


**What Are We Looking For?**


* Previous experience of 1+ in retail, working with personalized attention and sales objectives.
* Advanced level of English is essential.
* Flexible schedule to work evenings, weekends, and holidays.
* A person with a strong customer orientation, goal achievement, and great motivation to grow and develop their professional career.

  



Ready for this exciting challenge? Send us your story and let's start creating unforgettable moments together!
company_description: We are the jewelry brand that trusts its instinct and creates unique jewelry, without complexes. Designed and manufactured in Spain, and present in more than 80 markets.

title: Clerical Associate-Level IV - Ambulatory Care
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


Elmhurst Hospital Center (EHC) is the major tertiary care provider in the borough of Queens. The hospital is comprised of 545 beds and is a Level I Trauma Center, an Emergency Heart Care Station and a 911 Receiving Hospital. It is the premiere health care organization for key areas such as Surgery, Cardiology, Women's Health, Pediatrics, Rehabilitation Medicine, Renal and Mental Health Services.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


**Work Shifts**
---------------

  


9:00 A.M – 5:00 P.M

  

**Job Description**
-------------------

  


This class of positions encompasses clerical related office activities utilizing manual and automated office systems; duties may include supervision of employees performing routine tasks appropriate to each Assignment Level. There are three Assignment Levels within this class of positions. The following are typical assignments within this class of positions. All personnel perform related work.


**Duties & Responsibilities**
-----------------------------

  


1. Supervises personnel performing data processing functions in the areas of data entry, data control/coding, production control.


2. Under the direction of the unit head, assists in supervising personnel performing responsible clerical and related activities by processing, recording, financial counseling, checking, and maintaining records, furnishing information, and preparing reports.


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. A high school diploma or its educational equivalent; and


2. Six (6) months of full-time satisfactory clerical experience and/or experience interacting with the public, such as processing sales; taking, processing, and delivering orders; obtaining and dispensing information; listening to and resolving customers concerns, problems, and complaints; and/or performing related customer service activities.


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online at employment.nychhc.org.


NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs
